ProgramName: Associate of Science in Culinary Arts

Required documents for admission include a completed Application for Admission, a $35 Application Fee, and an official High School Transcript. UNA is test optional; ACT/SAT scores are not required for admission.
Department: Anderson College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering

ProgramName: Associate of Science in Hospitality and Events Management
Description: If you’re ready to start building a career in the dynamic and exciting hospitality and events industries, the University of North Alabama’s Associate of Science (AS) in Hospitality and Events Management will provide you with the foundational knowledge and skills you need. You will learn the core principles of hospitality operations, including front office management, food and beverage service, event planning, and customer relations. The curriculum is designed to equip you with the practical expertise and critical thinking abilities essential for success in entry-level and supervisory roles within hotels, resorts, restaurants, event venues, and more. With a strong emphasis on real-world application, this program prepares graduates to seamlessly transition into the workforce or continue their education at a four-year institution.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Business Administration in Accounting
EnglishScore: International applicants must submit one of the following to demonstrate English proficiency: TOEFL Internet-based test (iBT) with a minimum score of 61, TOEFL Paper-based test (PBT) with a minimum score of 500, IELTS with a minimum score of 5.5, PTE Academic with a minimum score of 46, Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 95, or successful completion of ELS Language Center's level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, applicants must submit an official high school transcript. The University of North Alabama is a test-optional institution for students applying with a 2.5 or higher high school GPA. For students who submit test scores, unconditional admission requires a minimum composite score of 18 on the ACT or a minimum of 940 on the SAT, along with a minimum high school GPA of 2.50. Conditional admission is possible with a minimum composite score of 16 on the ACT or 860 on the SAT and a minimum high school GPA of 2.00.
Department: College of Business and Technology
Description: The Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) degree provides students with a broad knowledge of business functions and processes. Students learn to think critically, solve problems, and communicate effectively, preparing them for a wide range of career opportunities in various industries or for further graduate study.
Accredidation: The College of Business is accredited by AACSB International, the premier accrediting body for collegiate business programs. Less than 5% of all business schools worldwide have earned AACSB accreditation.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Applied Health Science
EnglishScore: For international applicants, English Proficiency may be demonstrated by providing one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 61 on the iBT (Internet Based Test) or 500 on the PBT (Paper Based Test); International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum score of 5.5; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic with a minimum score of 46; Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 95; Successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 109.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Biology
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must provide evidence of English proficiency. This can be demonstrated by submitting an official score report from one of the following testing services: TOEFL: 61 iBT or 500 PBT; IELTS: 5.5; PTE: 46; Duolingo: 95; ELS: Level 112 with a 2.5 GPA.
Requirements:
Unconditional admission to the University may be granted to first-time freshmen who are graduates of a regionally accredited high school and meet one of the following criteria:
1. A minimum 2.50 cumulative high school GPA.
2. A minimum 2.00 cumulative high school GPA AND a minimum 18 ACT composite score or a minimum 960 SAT total score.

All students must submit an official high school transcript. The transcript must include the final senior grades, graduation date, and diploma type. Students must have completed the required number of high school courses.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Fees: In-State: $5,130 per semester; Out-of-State: $10,260 per semester (for 12-18 credit hours, based on 2023-2024 rates)
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Biology degree provides students with a broad exposure to biology and allows for a greater number of elective hours than the Bachelor of Science in Biology degree. The flexibility offered by the additional elective hours in the Bachelor of Arts degree provides an excellent opportunity for students to pursue a double major or a minor in a related field such as chemistry or psychology. The Bachelor of Arts degree is an ideal choice for students interested in preparing for careers in areas such as pharmacy, medical technology, health-related fields, environmental law, forensics, scientific illustration, or science writing.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $342 per credit hour; Out-of-State: $684 per credit hour
ScholarshipAmount: Varies, up to full tuition per year

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Biology
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must demonstrate English proficiency by submitting an acceptable score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL), International English Language Testing System (IELTS), Duolingo English Test (DET), Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE Academic), or by successful completion of the English Language Services (ELS) Level 112 course. Minimum scores are: TOEFL: 79 (iBT), 550 (PBT); IELTS: 6.0; Duolingo English Test (DET): 110; PTE Academic: 54.

First-time freshmen who have a 2.75 or higher high school GPA may be admitted to UNA without an ACT or SAT score.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Bachelor of Science (BS) in Biology is designed to provide students with a solid foundation in the biological sciences. The curriculum emphasizes critical thinking, problem-solving, and laboratory skills necessary for careers in biological research, healthcare, education, and various other fields. Students will develop a comprehensive understanding of biological principles, ranging from molecular and cellular biology to ecology and evolution. Concentrations are available in Pre-Health, Ecology and Environmental Biology, Microbiology/Cell Biology, Bioinformatics, and General Biology, allowing students to tailor their studies to specific career interests. Graduates of the program are well-prepared for entry-level positions in diverse biological fields or for further graduate or professional studies.
ScholarshipAmount: Varies, up to full tuition plus stipends

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Biology (Cellular & Molecular Biology Option)
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate proficiency in English. This requirement can be fulfilled by ONE of the following: TOEFL: Minimum score of 61 on the Internet-based test (IBT) or 500 on the paper-based test (PBT); IELTS: Minimum score of 5.5; PTE Academic (Pearson Test of English): Minimum score of 46; Duolingo English Test: Minimum score of 95; Successful completion of the English Language Services (ELS) Level 112.
Requirements: Students with a 2.50 or higher high school grade point average (GPA) will be admitted without an ACT or SAT test score. Students with a 2.00-2.49 high school GPA must have a minimum 18 ACT or 960 SAT to be admitted. Students with a high school GPA below a 2.00 must submit a complete application for committee review.
Department: Anderson College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: This option is designed for students interested in careers or graduate studies in molecular biology, cell biology, genetics, biotechnology, microbiology, immunology, virology, and related fields. It provides a strong foundation in the molecular and cellular aspects of biology, preparing students for research, industry, and advanced academic pursuits in these dynamic fields.
ScholarshipAmount: Varies, from $2,000/year up to full tuition plus allowances

ProgramName: Bachelor of Business Administration in Business Administration (Flex)
EnglishScore: Students from non-English speaking countries are required to submit proof of English proficiency. This can be accomplished by meeting the minimum requirements of any of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) iBT - 61, International English Language Testing System (IELTS) - 5.5, Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic - 46, Duolingo English Test - 95, Successful completion of the University of North Alabama’s intensive English as a Second Language (ESL) Program, or Successful completion of Level 112 at an ELS Language Center in the United States.

For students with a 3.0 GPA or higher, ACT/SAT scores are not required for admission. For students with a 2.99 GPA or lower, a minimum 18 ACT or 960 SAT score is required for regular admission.
Department: Sanders College of Business and Technology
Description: The Bachelor of Business Administration (B.B.A.) degree provides a strong core in business principles combined with a concentration in a specific area of business. In addition to the core, concentrations are offered in accounting, business administration (flex), economics, finance, general business, human resource management, management, and marketing. Students earning a B.B.A. degree are prepared for entry-level positions in a variety of business fields or for further study at the graduate level.
Accredidation: Accredited by AACSB International (for the College of Business and Technology)

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Chemistry
EnglishScore: Proof of English Proficiency can be met by providing an official score report from one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) minimum score of 61 on the internet-based test (iBT) or 500 on the paper-based test (PBT). International English Language Testing System (IELTS) minimum score of 5.5. Pearson Test of English (PTE) minimum score of 46. Duolingo minimum score of 95. ELS Language Center, Certificate of Completion of Level 112. Successful completion of UNA's English as a Second Language Program.
Requirements: Unconditional Admission may be granted to applicants who are high school graduates, have an official ACT or SAT score, and a minimum 2.0 cumulative high school GPA. Test-Optional Admission may be granted to students with a 2.50 or higher cumulative high school GPA. Required documents include: a completed application, a $35 application fee, an official high school transcript, and official ACT or SAT scores (unless applying for Test-Optional Admission).
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Chemistry provides a broad background in chemistry with less emphasis on advanced mathematics and physics than the Bachelor of Science programs. The degree is particularly well-suited for students wishing to combine the study of chemistry with another field through a double major or a minor, or for students interested in careers in areas such as forensic science, environmental science, secondary education, or in health-related fields. This major provides students with the background for admission to graduate programs in chemistry, biochemistry, and related fields as well as various professional schools (e.g., medical, dental, pharmacy).
CostPerCredit: $357 per credit hour (In-State); $647 per credit hour (Out-of-State)
ScholarshipType: Academic Scholarships, Endowed Scholarships, Performance Scholarships

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Chemistry
EnglishScore: Students from non-English speaking countries must provide evidence of English proficiency. Students may meet the English requirement in any one of the following ways: TOEFL score of 79 (iBT), 550 (pBT); IELTS score of 6.0; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic score of 54; Duolingo score of 100; Completion of Level 112 of the English for Academic Purposes (EAP) program from an ELS Language Center; Completion of UNA's Intensive English Program.
Requirements: Prospective students must complete the online application for undergraduate admission, pay the non-refundable $35 application fee, and submit an official high school transcript. The University of North Alabama offers test-optional admission to students with a 2.50 or higher high school GPA. For students who do not meet the test-optional criteria, official ACT or SAT scores must be submitted.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Chemistry is one of the foundational degrees in the sciences. The B.S. in Chemistry requires 120 credit hours and a minimum of 40 credit hours in Chemistry lecture and laboratory courses. This degree program is approved by the American Chemical Society (ACS) and provides the student with a comprehensive background in all areas of chemistry, including analytical, biochemistry, inorganic, organic, and physical chemistry. The Department of Chemistry and Physics offers the B.S. in Chemistry, the B.S. in Chemistry with American Chemical Society Certification, and the B.S. in Forensic Chemistry. Students graduating with a B.S. in Chemistry are well prepared for a wide range of career opportunities including chemistry, environmental science, chemical sales, chemical information science, technical writing, and laboratory support. Those students interested in pursuing professional or graduate studies in chemistry, biochemistry, chemical engineering, forensic science, medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, or other health professions will find the curriculum beneficial.
Accredidation: Approved by the American Chemical Society (ACS)
ScholarshipAmount: $3,000 - $8,000 per year, up to full tuition

ProgramName: Bachelor of Fine Arts in Cinematic Arts and Theatre
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit evidence of proficiency in the English language. One of the following tests is required for admission: TOEFL - score of 500 PBT (Paper-Based Test) or 61 iBT (Internet-Based Test); IELTS - score of 5.5; PTE (Pearson Test of English - Academic) - score of 46; Duolingo - score of 95; Completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Requirements: As there are no specific admission requirements listed for the Bachelor of Fine Arts in Cinematic Arts and Theatre program, the general freshman admission requirements for the university apply. According to the university's freshman requirements page, first-time freshmen are not required to submit an ACT or SAT score for admission. Unconditional admission is granted to students with a 2.25 GPA. Required documents include an official high school transcript. Submission of ACT or SAT scores is optional.
Department: School of the Arts
Concentration: Cinematic Arts Track and Theatre Track
Description: The Bachelor of Fine Arts in Cinematic Arts and Theatre provides an intensive professional education and pre-professional training for students seeking careers in film, television, or theatre. Students develop strong foundations in all aspects of filmmaking and theatre, including acting, directing, producing, screenwriting, cinematography, editing, sound design, stagecraft, and design. Through a rigorous curriculum combining theory and practice, students gain hands-on experience using industry-standard equipment and software. The program emphasizes collaboration, creativity, and critical thinking, preparing graduates to contribute meaningfully to the dynamic and evolving media and performing arts industries. It culminates in capstone projects allowing students to showcase their skills and artistic vision in a professional context.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Communication Arts
EnglishScore: International undergraduate applicants must provide proof of English proficiency. Accepted methods include a TOEFL score of 61 on the iBT or 500 on the PBT, an IELTS overall band score of 5.5, a PTE Academic score of 46, a Duolingo English Test score of 90, or completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements: General undergraduate admission to the University of North Alabama is required. For unconditional admission, applicants must have a minimum of a 2.25 high school GPA and a minimum ACT composite score of 18 (or SAT equivalent of 940). For conditional admission, applicants must have a minimum of a 2.00 high school GPA and a minimum ACT composite score of 16 (or SAT equivalent of 860). A test-optional admission path is available for students with a 2.75 GPA or higher.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Concentration: Strategic Communication, Public Advocacy, Visual Communication
Description: The B.A. in Communication Studies is a flexible program that allows students to customize their course of study in Communication through concentrations in Strategic Communication, Public Advocacy, or Visual Communication. This major is highly interdisciplinary and provides students with skills in critical thinking, writing, public speaking, visual communication, and the latest communication technologies. As one of the largest majors in the College of Arts and Sciences, the Communication Studies major gives students the foundational knowledge and skills to successfully communicate in a variety of personal and professional contexts. The program provides a broad understanding of communication theory and practice that prepares graduates for a wide range of career paths including public relations, marketing, journalism, media production, advocacy, and education. Students gain practical experience through internships, service-learning projects, and student organizations such as the UNA PRIDE Agency, Lambda Pi Eta, and the award-winning UNA Debate Team. The curriculum emphasizes ethical communication, cultural diversity, and global perspectives, ensuring graduates are well-rounded and prepared to make a positive impact in their communities and beyond. With a strong emphasis on practical skills and theoretical knowledge, the B.A. in Communication Studies prepares students for success in a rapidly evolving communication landscape.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Communication Arts
EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a score of 500 (Paper-based test) or 61 (Internet-based test) or higher. International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a score of 5.5 or higher. PTE with a score of 46 or higher. Duolingo English Test with a score of 90 or higher. Completion of Level 112 in the ELS Language Center's Intensive English Program at an ELS location in the United States.
Requirements:
To apply, a student must submit a completed application for admission, a $35 non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. UNA practices a test-optional admissions policy. This policy allows a student to be admitted without a test score with a 2.5 GPA. Students can submit test scores if they choose, and scores can still be used for scholarship and course placement purposes.

Unconditional Admission:
- Minimum 2.0 cumulative high school GPA and minimum 18 ACT or 940 SAT
- OR Minimum 2.5 cumulative high school GPA (test-optional)
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Bachelor of Arts (BA) or Bachelor of Science (BS) in Communication Arts provides students with an understanding of human communication processes, including intrapersonal, interpersonal, intercultural, small group, organizational, and public. This program is designed to develop students’ communication competencies and prepare them for careers in a variety of fields such as public relations, journalism, broadcasting, advertising, marketing, human resources, government, and non-profit organizations. It also provides a strong foundation for graduate studies in communication or related disciplines. Students choose a BA or a BS degree based on their interests and career goals. Both degrees provide an emphasis on communication theory, research, and practice. The BS degree requires additional coursework in a natural or social science discipline, providing a more quantitative and analytical focus, while the BA degree requires additional coursework in a foreign language or humanities discipline, providing a more liberal arts focus. Students will gain skills in critical thinking, research, writing, public speaking, and digital media production.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Business Administration in Computer Information Systems
EnglishScore: Proof of English proficiency must be submitted as part of the application package. Students may submit one of the following to show proficiency: TOEFL score of 61 iBT (500 PBT); IELTS score of 5.5; PTE score of 46; Duolingo score of 90; Successful completion of the University of North Alabama’s intensive English as a Second Language (ESL) Program; Successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Requirements: To be considered for admission to the University of North Alabama as a first-time freshman, a student must submit an application for admission, a non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. The University of North Alabama practices test-optional admission. ACT/SAT scores are not required for admission into the university but may be submitted for scholarship consideration and course placement. Unconditional Admission requires a minimum 2.25 high school GPA, while Conditional Admission requires a minimum 2.00 high school GPA.
Department: Sanders College of Business and Technology
Description: The Bachelor of Business Administration in Computer Information Systems (BBA-CIS) program prepares students for a variety of entry-level business positions utilizing information technology. The curriculum focuses on business applications, including programming, systems analysis and design, database management, web applications, cybersecurity, data analytics, and networking. The program combines business courses and computer information systems courses to provide a broad understanding of how technology can be used to solve business problems and improve organizational efficiency. Upon completion of the program, students will be able to analyze, design, and implement information systems, manage data resources, develop web-based applications, and understand cybersecurity principles. Graduates are prepared for careers such as business systems analysts, database administrators, web developers, cybersecurity analysts, and data analysts.
Accredidation: AACSB International

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
EnglishScore: English proficiency must be demonstrated by any one of the following methods for undergraduate admissions: TOEFL iBT score of 61, IELTS score of 5.5, PTE score of 46, Duolingo score of 90, GTEC CBT score of 987, Successful completion of UNA's English as a Second Language Program, Graduation from a US high school, Successful completion of English Composition I and II with a grade of "C" or better from an accredited US institution, or Proof of citizenship from an exempt country.
Requirements: To be considered for admission to the University of North Alabama as a first-time freshman, applicants must submit an application for admission and an official high school transcript. The submission of ACT or SAT scores is optional due to the university's test-optional admissions policy. For unconditional admission, students must have a regular high school diploma and either a minimum 2.25 high school GPA OR a minimum 2.00 high school GPA with a composite ACT score of 20 or an SAT combined score of 1020. For conditional admission, students must have a regular high school diploma and either a minimum 2.00 high school GPA OR a composite ACT score of 18 or an SAT combined score of 940.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) degree in Computer Science is designed to prepare students for careers in computer science and for further study in graduate school. Computer science is a broad and rapidly changing field that includes the study of algorithms, data structures, computer organization, operating systems, programming languages, software engineering, and database systems. The program provides a strong foundation in these areas, as well as in mathematics and science. Students will develop problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and the ability to design, implement, and test complex software systems. The program also emphasizes ethical considerations in computing and the importance of lifelong learning.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $360.00 per credit hour, Out-of-State: $720.00 per credit hour
ScholarshipType: Excellence Scholarships (Academic, Leadership, Performance), Endowed Scholarships, UNA Foundation Scholarships, External Scholarships

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Criminal Justice
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must provide evidence of proficiency in the English language. The most common exams and the required minimum scores for undergraduate admissions are TOEFL (IBT): 61, IELTS: 5.5, PTE (Pearson Test of English): 46, Duolingo English Test: 95, ELS: Level 112 with a 2.5 GPA.
Requirements: Admission to the University of North Alabama is based on a holistic review of a student's application. Applicants must have a minimum high school GPA of 2.25. Required documents include the application for undergraduate admission, a non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. Standardized test scores (ACT/SAT) are not required for admission to the university but are used for placement in English and mathematics courses and for awarding academic and competitive scholarships.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Department of Criminal Justice offers a Bachelor of Arts degree in Criminal Justice and two minors: Criminal Justice and Forensic Science. The mission of the Department of Criminal Justice is to provide an educational program that prepares students for employment in various components of the criminal justice system at the federal, state, and local levels and to provide a foundation for graduate study. Students are provided with a comprehensive curriculum that includes theoretical and applied knowledge in criminal justice. The faculty prepares students for a diverse society through the development of critical thinking, effective communication, and problem-solving skills.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Criminal Justice
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English are required to demonstrate English proficiency. This can be demonstrated by one of the following: TOEFL (minimum score of 61 iBT or 500 PBT), IELTS (minimum score of 5.5), PTE Academic (minimum score of 46), Duolingo (minimum score of 95), or completion of the ELS Language Centers Intensive English Program Level 112.
Requirements: For unconditional admission, freshman applicants must have a minimum 2.25 cumulative high school GPA (on a 4.0 scale). An official high school transcript, GED, or home school transcript is required for admission.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Criminal Justice Program at the University of North Alabama seeks to provide a high-quality educational experience for its students by providing instruction in theoretical and applied knowledge of the criminal justice system to foster career readiness for employment in criminal justice agencies or prepare students for graduate and/or law school. The program aims to provide students with the theoretical and applied knowledge of the criminal justice system, the ability to think critically and express themselves effectively, and the knowledge and skills necessary for employment in criminal justice agencies or preparation for graduate and/or law school.
ScholarshipAmount: Amounts range from $3,000 per year up to full tuition, room, and board.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Culinary Arts Management
EnglishScore: All students must demonstrate English proficiency before admission to the university. This can be demonstrated by achieving a minimum score on one of the following tests: TOEFL (61 iBT or 500 PBT), IELTS (5.5), PTE (46), or Duolingo (95). Completion of Level 112 in the ELS Language Centers Intensive Program also satisfies this requirement.
Requirements: The minimum requirements for admission to the University as a first-time freshman are as follows: Submit an official high school transcript or GED score. Submit an official ACT or SAT score. (Beginning with the fall 2021 entering class, UNA is test-optional for students who have a 3.0 or higher high school GPA.)
Department: College of Education and Human Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Culinary Arts Management degree provides students with an education focused on culinary skills, food safety, nutrition, and cost control for restaurants, food service businesses, and institutional kitchens. The program prepares students for leadership roles in the culinary industry including executive chef, catering director, restaurant manager, and food and beverage director. Students will gain practical experience in the commercial kitchen at the Lion’s Den, the hospitality management program’s dining lab.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Business Administration in Economics
EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries must submit evidence of English proficiency. Any of the following is acceptable: TOEFL: 79 IBT (internet based), 550 PBT (paper based), IELTS: 6.0, PTE: 54, Duolingo: 110, ELS: Completion of Level 112 of the English Language Services (ELS) Program.
Requirements: General university admission requirements for freshmen include submission of an application, official high school transcript, and an official ACT or SAT score. For unconditional admission, a student must have a 2.25 GPA and a 16 ACT/880 SAT score. For students who have a GPA of 2.0-2.24, the ACT must be an 18/950 SAT. Additionally, to be admitted to the College of Business and Technology, an undergraduate student must have an overall GPA of 2.0 or higher. The student must have also completed MA 112 or a higher level mathematics course, EC 221, EC 222, AC 291, CIS 125, and QM 291 with a grade of C or better in each course and an average GPA of 2.0 in those courses.
Department: College of Business and Technology
Description: The Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) degree is designed to provide graduates with a broad understanding of business principles and practices, and to prepare them for careers in a variety of business fields or for graduate study. All BBA candidates must complete the business core requirements and major-specific requirements. The BBA in Economics provides students with a broad understanding of economic principles and how they apply to a variety of business, policy, and social issues. Students will learn to analyze markets, firms, and economic policies using quantitative and qualitative methods. This program prepares students for careers in business, government, and non-profit organizations, as well as for graduate studies in economics, law, or business.
Accredidation: Accredited by AACSB International
ScholarshipAmount: $3,000 up to Full Tuition per year

ProgramName: Bachelor of Engineering
EnglishScore: International applicants must demonstrate proficiency in English. One of the following is required as proof of proficiency: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) minimum score of 61 on the Internet-based test (iBT), 500 on the paper-based test (pbt); International English Language Testing System (IELTS) minimum score of 5.5; Pearson Test of English (PTE) academic minimum score of 46; Duolingo English test with a minimum score of 95; or successful completion of the English Language Services (ELS) Level 112.
Requirements: To apply, prospective students must submit an online Application for Admission, a $35 Application Fee, and an official High School Transcript. For the Engineering Technology program, official ACT and/or SAT scores are explicitly required. While the university offers test-optional admission for students with a 3.00 or higher GPA, this option is not available for Engineering Technology program consideration. Admission is granted based on a combination of high school GPA and test scores, such as a minimum 2.50 GPA with a 16 ACT or 860 SAT, or a minimum 2.25 GPA with an 18 ACT or 940 SAT.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Bachelor of Engineering (B.E.) is a general engineering degree that emphasizes a broad engineering education allowing graduates to pursue various career opportunities. The program prepares graduates for further study in graduate school or for employment in the chemical, civil, computer, electrical, industrial, and mechanical engineering fields. Graduates are expected to possess a strong background in mathematics and sciences with a broad knowledge of different engineering disciplines as well as strong communication skills to be able to work in interdisciplinary teams to solve complex problems within the global economy. All concentrations within the B.E. program are accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET.
Accredidation: Accredited by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of ABET.
ScholarshipAmount: Academic scholarships range from $3,000 to over $8,500 per year.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Engineering Technology
EnglishScore: All students from non-English speaking countries must provide proof of English proficiency. Students can prove English proficiency by meeting the requirements of one of the following: TOEFL: Minimum score of 61 on the iBT or 500 on the PBT; IELTS: Minimum score of 5.5; PTE: Minimum score of 46; Duolingo: Minimum score of 95; Completion of the University of North Alabama’s intensive English as a Second Language Program (ESL); Proof of graduation from a secondary institution in which English is the language of instruction.
Requirements: The University of North Alabama offers unconditional and conditional admission. Unconditional Admission: A minimum composite score of 20 on the ACT (or 1030 on the SAT-ERW+M) and a minimum of 2.25 high school GPA. The University of North Alabama offers a test-optional admissions plan for freshman students with a minimum of 3.0 high school GPA.
Department: School of Science, Engineering, and Mathematics
Concentration: Advanced Manufacturing, Computer-Aided Design and Drafting (CADD), Construction Management, Electrical Technology, Industrial Management, Occupational Health and Safety, Robotics and Automation
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Engineering Technology program is designed to provide students with a broad and fundamental education in the applied engineering sciences and technology fields. The program emphasizes the application of scientific and engineering principles to the design, implementation, and operation of engineered systems. Students in the program will develop problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and practical expertise through hands-on experiences and theoretical coursework. Graduates will be prepared for technical and management careers in various industries, including manufacturing, automation, energy, and construction, or for further graduate studies.
Accredidation: Accredited by the Engineering Technology Accreditation Commission of ABET, https://www.abet.org.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in English
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must submit evidence of English proficiency. This can be done by submitting one of the following: a minimum score of 500 on the paper-based TOEFL (PBT) or 61 on the internet-based TOEFL (iBT); a minimum score of 5.5 on the IELTS; a minimum score of 46 on the PTE Academic; a minimum score of 95 on the Duolingo English Test; or completion of ELS Language Centers Level 109. Exemptions may apply for students from certain English-speaking countries or those who have completed specific coursework in the U.S.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, students should submit an application for admission, official high school transcript, and official ACT or SAT scores. To be admitted unconditionally, applicants must have a minimum composite score of 18 on the ACT (or SAT equivalent) AND a minimum 2.00 high school GPA. The University of North Alabama is test-optional for students with a 3.0 or higher cumulative high school GPA.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in English from the University of North Alabama provides students with a broad and deep understanding of literature, language, and writing. The program emphasizes critical thinking, analytical skills, and effective communication, preparing them for diverse career paths and advanced studies. Students will engage with a wide range of literary texts from various periods and cultures, develop their analytical and interpretive abilities, and refine their writing through different genres and styles. The curriculum is designed to foster intellectual curiosity, creativity, and a nuanced appreciation of the power of language. The program offers concentrations in Creative Writing, Professional Writing, Film Studies, and Literary Studies, allowing students to tailor their degree to their specific interests and career aspirations. Graduates are well-prepared for careers in fields such as education, publishing, journalism, marketing, law, and government, as well as for graduate studies in English or related disciplines.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in English
EnglishScore: English proficiency must be documented by one of the following: 61 on the TOEFL iBT, 500 on the TOEFL pBT, 5.5 on the IELTS, 46 on the PTE, 95 on the Duolingo, or successful completion of ELS Language Centers Level 109.

A minimum composite score of 20 on the ACT (or 1030 on the SAT-ERW+M); or 2. A minimum 2.50 cumulative high school grade point average (GPA). Conditional admission may be granted to students who do not meet unconditional admission requirements with a minimum composite score of 16 on the ACT (or 880 on the SAT-ERW+M) and a minimum 2.0 cumulative high school grade point average.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: Our Bachelor of Science in English and Writing degree helps you discover your creative edge by mastering the art of the written word. This B.S. program is offered 100% online or in a residential format, so you can pursue your degree in a way that best fits your schedule and learning style. Whether you are passionate about literature, creative writing, or education, our B.S. in English and Writing program will challenge you to think critically about texts and develop a versatile skill set in communication. The B.S. in English and Writing program provides students with a Christ-centered academic experience built on a liberal arts foundation. You’ll be able to explore the art of writing while diving into some of the most prominent pieces of literature in history. You’ll also get the chance to: Become proficient in language, rhetoric, and composition; Develop advanced skills in critical thinking, research, and communication; Grow in a Christ-centered community and gain spiritual leadership skills; Receive mentorship from professors who have years of experience in their field; Study topics like fiction writing, screenwriting, poetry, and literary analysis.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Entertainment Industry

UNA is test-optional for students with a 2.50 or higher high school GPA.
Department: School of the Arts
Description: The Entertainment Industry program at the University of North Alabama provides students with a broad knowledge of the entertainment industry combined with focused training in one of four concentrations. The program offers both a Bachelor of Arts (BA) and a Bachelor of Science (BS) degree option for its students. Graduates of the program are prepared for a variety of careers in entertainment or to continue their education in graduate school.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Entertainment Industry

Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering

Description: The Bachelor of Science in Entertainment Industry is designed to provide students with the skills and knowledge to enter the entertainment industry in a variety of capacities. This interdisciplinary program provides students with a broad understanding of the creative, technical, and business aspects of the entertainment industry. Students will gain practical experience in areas such as audio production, video production, live event management, and business practices specific to the entertainment sector. The curriculum is structured to foster critical thinking, problem-solving, and collaboration, preparing graduates for dynamic careers in fields such as music, film, television, gaming, and live performance. The program is offered through the Department of Communications and Theatre and includes courses from various disciplines including Communication, Computer Science, Marketing, and Management. It offers two areas of emphasis: Performance and Technical/Business, allowing students to tailor their studies to their career interests.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $359.00 per credit hour; Out-of-State: $718.00 per credit hour

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Entertainment Industry (Entertainment Business Option)

The Office of Admissions reserves the right to require an ACT/SAT score on a case-by-case basis. Test scores will be required for some academic scholarships, nursing and honors college admission.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Entertainment Industry is designed to provide students with comprehensive skills and knowledge across various facets of the entertainment world. With concentrations in Entertainment Business, Production and Performance, and Technical Production, students can tailor their degree to their specific interests and career aspirations. Our curriculum balances theoretical knowledge with hands-on experience, preparing graduates for successful careers in dynamic fields such as music, film, television, live events, and emerging digital media.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Entertainment Industry (Entertainment Business Option)

Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Entertainment Industry prepares students for a variety of careers in the music, recording, film, television, and game industries. Students gain an understanding of entertainment history, industry business, production processes, and technology. Students select from the following options: Production and Technology, Entertainment Business, or Emerging Media.
ScholarshipAmount: Academic scholarships range from $2,000 - $7,500 per year, up to full tuition, room, board, and fees.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Entertainment Industry (Entertainment Technology Option)

Description: The Entertainment Technology option provides students with the opportunity to develop skills and knowledge in the technical aspects of the entertainment industry including sound production, lighting, video, editing, and staging. Students will gain hands-on experience in various entertainment technology applications, preparing them for roles in live events, broadcasting, film, and other media-related fields. A strong emphasis is placed on practical application and industry-standard technologies.

EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must provide evidence of proficiency in the English language. For unconditional admission, a minimum high school GPA of 3.0 is required. For conditional admission, a minimum high school GPA of 2.0 is required. The University of North Alabama is test-optional for admissions purposes, and the submission of an ACT or SAT score is not required for a student to be considered for admission.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Entertainment Industry provides students with foundational knowledge of the entertainment industry, while allowing them to specialize in specific areas of the industry through selected options. The entertainment industry program embraces a hybrid approach of traditional communication and business coursework combined with hands-on, skills-based learning. Students learn practical application in music, film, television, web-based media, and other entertainment related fields in their respective option. Internship opportunities and industry-focused curriculum provide students with experience prior to graduation. Graduates are prepared for careers in a wide range of fields related to music, film, television, game development, and live event production, depending on their chosen option. The Entertainment Technology Option prepares students to be successful in the technical areas of the entertainment industry. Students learn technical skills in areas such as audio and video production, live event production, entertainment lighting, computer aided design (CAD), game development, and augmented/virtual reality technologies. Graduates are prepared for technical positions in live event production, film, television, game development, audio production, and other entertainment technology related fields.
ScholarshipAmount: Awards range from $2,500/year up to full cost of attendance.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Exercise Science
EnglishScore: An applicant whose native language is not English must submit a satisfactory score on the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) or the International English Language Testing System (IELTS). The minimum acceptable score on the paper-based TOEFL is 500, the minimum acceptable score on the internet-based TOEFL is 61, or the minimum acceptable score on the IELTS is 5.5. UNA also accepts completion of the ELS Language Center’s course of study at Level 112 in lieu of the TOEFL or IELTS. Additionally, UNA accepts the Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic with a score of 46 or Duolingo with a minimum score of 95.
Requirements: Students who have completed the general education requirements and have earned an overall GPA of 2.75 or above are eligible for admission into the Exercise Science Major. Students may apply for admission by completing an application form in the HPER Office.
Department: Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Exercise Science program provides students with a strong scientific foundation related to health, human movement, and disease prevention. The Exercise Science major will provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to prepare them for careers in a variety of health and fitness professions (e.g., strength and conditioning coach, exercise physiologist, health fitness specialist, personal trainer, clinical exercise physiologist, etc.) or for graduate study (e.g., physical therapy, occupational therapy, chiropractic, medicine, physician assistant, exercise physiology, etc.). The curriculum includes courses in anatomy and physiology, biomechanics, exercise physiology, nutrition, strength and conditioning, exercise testing and prescription, and motor learning. The program is committed to developing competent and ethical professionals dedicated to promoting healthy lifestyles and improving the quality of life for individuals across the lifespan.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Fashion Merchandising and Design
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit one of the following: TOEFL: 500 (paper based test) or 173 (computer based test) or 61 (internet based test); IELTS: 5.5; Duolingo: 90; PTE Academic: 46; Completion of the advanced level of UNA's English as a Second Language (ESL) Program.

Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering

Description: The Bachelor of Science (B.S.) in Fashion Merchandising and Design offers students the option to focus their studies in either fashion merchandising or fashion design. Graduates of the program are prepared for a variety of careers in the fashion industry, including fashion buyer, visual merchandiser, apparel designer, textile designer, product developer, fashion illustrator, retail manager, and more. The Fashion Merchandising and Design program at the University of North Alabama offers students a comprehensive education in the dynamic and evolving fashion industry. Students gain hands-on experience through internships, study tours, and participation in fashion shows and industry events. The program emphasizes creativity, critical thinking, and practical skills development, preparing students for successful careers in various aspects of the fashion world. UNA's location in Florence, Alabama, a city known for its vibrant arts and culture scene, provides unique opportunities for students to connect with local designers, boutiques, and businesses, further enhancing their learning experience.
ScholarshipAmount: Amounts vary, up to full tuition.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Business Administration in Finance
EnglishScore: International students must demonstrate English proficiency to qualify for unconditional admission. Department: College of Business and Technology
Description: A major in Finance (FIN) will introduce students to the areas of financial management, banking, investments, financial planning, real estate, and international finance. Through a combination of general education, business core, and finance coursework, students will develop analytical skills and knowledge useful in a variety of financial careers.
Accredidation: Accredited by AACSB International

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Fitness Management
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit proof of English proficiency by providing an official score report from one of the following: TOEFL iBT (61), IELTS (5.5), PTE (46), Duolingo (90), or completion of Level 112 of the ELS Language Centers' English for Academic Purposes program.
Department: College of Education and Human Sciences
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Health and Fitness degree with a concentration in Fitness Management prepares students for professional careers in the growing field of health and fitness. This concentration is designed to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to work in various settings such as corporate fitness programs, wellness centers, hospitals, community fitness programs, and sports performance facilities. Students will gain a strong foundation in exercise science, nutrition, program design, and business management principles specific to the fitness industry. The curriculum emphasizes both theoretical knowledge and practical application, preparing graduates to manage fitness facilities, develop comprehensive wellness programs, and lead clients towards healthier lifestyles.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Foreign Languages
EnglishScore: Students from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following: TOEFL: 61 iBT / 500 PBT; IELTS: 5.5; PTE: 46; Duolingo: 95; ELS: Level 109; Successful completion of UNA's Intensive English Program; Successful completion of 24 credit hours of academic coursework from a regionally accredited U.S. university/college.
Requirements: To be considered for admission, students must submit: an official high school transcript or GED score, an official ACT or SAT score, and a non-refundable $35 application fee. For unconditional admission for those submitting scores, a minimum 2.25 high school GPA is required along with a minimum composite score of 18 on the ACT or a minimum combined score of 960 on the SAT.

Description: The Department of Foreign Languages provides opportunities for students to study the languages and cultures of France, Germany, and Spain/Latin America. The ability to communicate in another language is not only personally enriching but also an important asset in an increasingly global society. The Bachelor of Arts in Foreign Languages prepares students to live and work in the global community and provides the necessary foundation for students wishing to pursue graduate studies in French or Spanish. Courses in French and Spanish provide students with proficiency in the target language and a thorough understanding of the culture. Minors in French, German, and Spanish are also available. Students majoring in a foreign language should consult with the chair of the Department of Foreign Languages to plan their programs.
ScholarshipAmount: Academic scholarships range from $5,000 to $10,560 per year.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Geography
EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries must provide evidence of English proficiency. This can be demonstrated by meeting the minimum score on one of the following: TOEFL iBT (61), TOEFL PBT (500), IELTS (5.5), PTE (46), Duolingo English Test (95), or completion of Level 112 of the English Language Services (ELS) Program.
Department: School of Science, Engineering and Mathematics
Description: The Department of Geoscience offers a Bachelor of Arts (BA) or a Bachelor of Science (BS) in Geography, a Bachelor of Science (BS) in Geology, and a Bachelor of Science (BS) in Geospatial Science. Minors are also available in Geography, Geology, and Geospatial Science. The Geoscience program explores the earth system through the disciplines of geology, geography, and geospatial science. Students learn to think critically and apply a scientific approach to understanding the physical and cultural processes that shape the earth and human society. Students learn to use various tools and techniques to analyze and interpret data, including GIS, remote sensing, and field methods. Graduates are prepared for careers in environmental consulting, natural resource management, urban and regional planning, geological mapping, hazard assessment, and various government agencies. The program also provides a strong foundation for graduate studies in geology, geography, environmental science, and related fields.
ScholarshipAmount: Varies; Academic scholarships range from $3,000 to full tuition per year.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Geography
EnglishScore: Students must meet ONE of the following to show English Proficiency: TOEFL IBT - 61, TOEFL PBT - 500, IELTS - 5.5, Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic - 46, Duolingo - 95, ELS - Completion of Level 112.
Requirements: For unconditional admission, first-time freshmen must have a minimum high school GPA of 2.25 AND a minimum composite score of 18 on the ACT or a 970 on the SAT. For conditional admission, applicants may have a high school GPA of 2.0 and a composite score of 16 on the ACT or a 880 on the SAT. For students who apply test-optional, you must have a minimum high school GPA of 2.5.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Bachelor of Science (BS) in Geography offers three options (Standard, Geographic Information Science, and Earth Systems Science) and prepares students for careers in diverse fields such as environmental science, city and regional planning, cartography, Geographic Information Systems (GIS), hydrology, meteorology, climatology, remote sensing, and location analysis. It also provides an excellent foundation for graduate studies in Geography and related fields. Geography is the interdisciplinary study of the Earth’s surface processes and human interactions with the natural world, focusing on spatial patterns and relationships. Geographers study the physical environment and human landscapes through qualitative and quantitative analysis, fieldwork, mapping, and the use of cutting-edge geospatial technologies (GIS, remote sensing, and GPS).

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Health & Fitness
EnglishScore: All international students must demonstrate proficiency in English. Requirements: UNA has two paths for unconditional freshman admission: 1. A minimum 2.0 cumulative high school GPA (on a 4.0 scale) and a minimum composite score of 18 on the ACT or 960 on the SAT (evidenced-based reading/writing + math). 2. A minimum 2.5 cumulative high school GPA (on a 4.0 scale).
Department: Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Health & Fitness program prepares students for careers in the rapidly growing field of health promotion and wellness. Graduates of this program are qualified for employment in various settings, including corporate wellness programs, hospitals, community health organizations, fitness centers, and governmental agencies. Students can also pursue graduate studies in related fields such as exercise physiology, public health, and physical therapy.
CostPerCredit: $355 per credit hour (In-State) or $710 per credit hour (Out-of-State)

Other exemptions may apply for native English speakers or those with prior education in the US.
Requirements: To be considered for admission to UNA, you need to submit the following: Online Application for Admission, $35 Application Fee, Official High School Transcript, Official ACT or SAT Score.
Department: Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Hospitality and Events Management
EnglishScore: Students must present proof of English proficiency by one of the following: TOEFL score of 61 iBT (internet-based), 500 PBT (paper-based), or 173 CBT (computer-based); IELTS score of 5.5; PTE (Pearson Test of English) score of 46; or Duolingo English Test with a score of 95.

The university offers a test-optional admission policy for students who have a 3.0 or higher high school grade point average.

Description: The Hospitality and Events Management program provides students with a strong business foundation and specialized knowledge in the management of hospitality operations and events. The curriculum includes courses in hotel operations, food and beverage management, event planning and execution, tourism, and marketing, preparing students for leadership roles in various segments of the hospitality and events industry. Graduates will possess the analytical, critical thinking, and communication skills necessary to succeed in a dynamic global environment.
CollegeApplicationFee: In-State: $10,800/Year; Out-of-State: $21,600/Year (based on 30 credit hours for 2024-2025)
ScholarshipType: Academic merit, leadership, and talent as well as other criteria specified by donors

ProgramName: Bachelor of Fine Arts in Interior Architecture and Design
EnglishScore: An applicant whose primary language is not English is required to demonstrate proficiency in the English language. This can be met by providing a minimum score on one of several tests: TOEFL (500 PBT or 61 iBT), IELTS (5.5), PTE (46), Duolingo (95), or by completing ELS Level 112.
Requirements: Unconditional admission to the University may be granted to a first-time freshman who meets the following criteria: Has a minimum high school GPA of 2.25 or higher; and, Has a composite score of 18 or higher on the ACT (or 960 on the SAT, taken March 2016 or after). Students who have a GPA of 2.00-2.24 must have a composite score of 20 on the ACT (or 1030 on the SAT, taken March 2016 or after) for unconditional admission. Students who have a composite score of 16-17 on the ACT (or 880-950 on the SAT) must have a GPA of 2.50 or higher for unconditional admission. The University of North Alabama is test-optional for students through the fall 2025 entry term. High school graduates who have at least a 3.0 GPA but do not have an ACT or SAT score on file may be admitted.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Bachelor of Fine Arts in Interior Architecture and Design is a professional degree that prepares students for careers in the dynamic and growing field of interior architecture and design. The curriculum provides a broad base of knowledge, skills, and creative problem-solving abilities necessary to become competent design professionals, providing the highest quality of design for the built environment. Students learn to critically analyze complex design problems from a variety of perspectives, including historical, theoretical, environmental, social, and cultural contexts. The program provides the foundational skills and conceptual knowledge for creating innovative and sustainable interior environments that enhance human well-being and productivity. The B.F.A. program emphasizes design studio courses that focus on both residential and commercial projects, ranging in scale from small residential spaces to large-scale public institutions. Students develop strong visual communication skills through hand sketching, digital rendering, and model making. The program also integrates professional practice courses, including business practices, project management, and ethics, preparing students for successful careers in the industry.
Accredidation: The Bachelor of Fine Arts in Interior Architecture and Design program is accredited by the Council for Interior Design Accreditation (CIDA).
ScholarshipAmount: Up to a full ride, with other awards ranging from $3,000 to $8,000 per year.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Interdisciplinary Studies
EnglishScore: All applicants whose native language is not English must provide evidence of English proficiency. Minimum scores include TOEFL (61 iBT or 500 PBT), IELTS (5.5), PTE (46), Duolingo (95), or successful completion of ELS Level 112.
Requirements:
ADMISSION REQUIREMENTS FOR FIRST-TIME FRESHMEN: Students who meet the criteria for regular admission must meet one of the following requirements:

A minimum 2.25 high school GPA and a minimum 18 ACT (960 SAT).
OR
A minimum 2.50 high school GPA and a minimum 16 ACT (880 SAT).
OR
A minimum 3.00 high school GPA.

UNA is currently Test Optional for admissions. Students must have a 2.5 GPA for admissions without a test score. Students who don't meet this requirement may still be considered for admissions with a test score.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Bachelor of Arts in Interdisciplinary Studies (IDS) is designed for students who desire a personalized and flexible course of study. The IDS major provides students with the opportunity to synthesize courses from multiple disciplines into a cohesive program of study focused on an interdisciplinary theme, question, or problem. Students work closely with an IDS faculty advisor to create a unique course of study around an interdisciplinary focus. The IDS major offers students the opportunity to integrate knowledge from a variety of disciplines and apply it to an interdisciplinary topic of their choosing. Students learn how to analyze complex issues from multiple perspectives, develop critical thinking skills, and effectively communicate their ideas. The IDS program is especially well-suited for students who seek to combine diverse academic interests and design an academic path that is truly their own. This unique degree offers both breadth and depth through its interdisciplinary framework. Students are afforded the opportunity to gain expertise in a chosen area of interest by selecting upper-division courses from two or more departments, colleges, or programs. The IDS curriculum offers students flexibility in tailoring a program of study to meet their individual goals and professional aspirations. The IDS curriculum prepares graduates for a wide array of career options as well as graduate and professional studies. In addition to gaining expertise in a chosen area of interest, students will complete an Interdisciplinary Studies senior project/capstone. The senior project provides an opportunity for students to demonstrate their ability to integrate knowledge from across their selected disciplines, apply critical analysis, and communicate their findings effectively.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Interdisciplinary Studies
EnglishScore: Applicants from non-English speaking countries must submit one of the following to satisfy the English proficiency requirement: TOEFL score of 61 iBT or 500 PBT; IELTS score of 5.5; PTE score of 46; Duolingo score of 95; ELS, completion of Level 112.
Requirements: The University of North Alabama is test-optional for admission purposes. Applicants with a minimum 2.25 high school GPA may be admitted without an ACT or SAT score. Applicants may also qualify for traditional admission with a minimum 2.0 high school GPA and a minimum 18 ACT composite score or 960 SAT composite score.
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: Interdisciplinary Studies represents a field of study in which students learn to integrate knowledge from two or more academic disciplines to address complex problems or questions. Rather than viewing problems through the lens of a single discipline, students in Interdisciplinary Studies are taught to synthesize insights from multiple perspectives to gain a more comprehensive understanding. The Bachelor of Science in Interdisciplinary Studies (BIS) degree at the University of North Alabama allows students to design their own degree program by combining a minimum of three academic disciplines (18-36 hours) into a customized curriculum that meets their unique academic and professional goals. This program is offered completely online, making it ideal for place-bound students and working adults seeking a flexible pathway to degree completion. A BIS degree allows students to cultivate skills in critical thinking, research, communication, and problem-solving through a self-designed curriculum that aligns with their professional and personal interests. This degree helps students develop a broad and adaptable skill set that is attractive to employers in a wide range of fields. UNA's BIS program is offered completely online, allowing students to balance their education with work, family, and other commitments.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Business Administration in Professional Management (Accommodation and Service Industry Management Concentration)
EnglishScore: Proficiency in English must be demonstrated by ONE of the following: TOEFL: Minimum score of 61 on Internet-based test (IBT); or 500 on paper-based test (PBT). IELTS: Minimum score of 5.5. PTE Academic: Minimum score of 46. Duolingo: Minimum score of 95. ELS: Completion of ELS Language Centers Level 112.
Requirements:
The program catalog states that admission to the College of Business and Technology is open to all students admitted to the University. The University of North Alabama's freshman admission requirements are as follows:

UNA is a test optional institution, and ACT/SAT scores are not required for admission for students with a 2.5 GPA or higher.

Students with a 2.00-2.49 GPA must submit an official ACT/SAT score for admission review.

Admission Types:
- Unconditional Admission: Students with a 2.25 GPA and an 18 ACT or a 960 SAT are unconditionally admitted to UNA.
- Conditional Admission: Students with a 2.00 GPA and a 16-17 ACT or an 880-950 SAT are conditionally admitted to UNA.
Department: College of Business and Technology
Description: The Bachelor of Business Administration in Professional Management offers concentrations to prepare students to work in various business settings. The program will enhance the ability of students to develop solutions to complex organizational problems and implement various management techniques. This degree is designed to develop a comprehensive understanding of human behavior in organizations, resource management, organizational behavior and performance. The program curriculum is suitable for both traditional and non-traditional students and aims to provide students with the business skills and knowledge to succeed in diverse management fields.
Accredidation: AACSB International (The Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business) accreditation

ProgramName: Bachelor of Business Administration in Professional Marketing (Digital Marketing Concentration)
EnglishScore: All students from non-English speaking countries must submit proof of English language proficiency. Acceptable proofs include: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) minimum score of 61 on Internet-based test (IBT) or 500 on paper-based test (PBT); International English Language Testing System (IELTS) minimum score of 5.5; Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic minimum score of 46; Duolingo English Test minimum score of 95; or Completion of the ELS Language Centers level 112. Other options such as graduation from a U.S. high school are also accepted.
Requirements: General freshman admission to the university requires a high school diploma or GED. Unconditional admission requires a minimum 2.00 high school GPA and a minimum composite score of 18 on the ACT (or 960 on the SAT-I). A test-optional policy is available for students with a 2.50 or higher cumulative high school GPA. After admission to the university, students are admitted to the B.B.A. Degree Program upon successful completion of the following with a cumulative grade point average of 2.0 or higher: CIS 125, EC 251, EC 252, AC 291, AC 292, MA 112 or higher, EN 111, and EN 112.
Department: College of Business and Technology
Description: The Bachelor of Business Administration degree with a major in Professional Marketing (BBA) is an excellent choice for students who want to develop the knowledge and skills necessary to successfully compete in the rapidly evolving marketing environment. The curriculum covers a wide range of topics, including marketing principles, consumer behavior, market research, digital marketing strategies, professional selling, and international marketing. Students gain a deep understanding of how to identify target markets, develop effective marketing campaigns, and build strong customer relationships. Additionally, students have the option to specialize in either Digital Marketing or Professional Sales, allowing them to tailor their education to their specific career interests. With a strong emphasis on practical application and real-world case studies, graduates of the Professional Marketing BBA program are well-prepared for a variety of marketing roles in both corporate and non-profit organizations. Overall, this program provides a comprehensive and practical education that equips students with the skills and knowledge needed to excel in the dynamic field of marketing.
Accredidation: All College of Business Administration degree programs are accredited by AACSB International.
ScholarshipAmount: Varies, up to full tuition, fees, room, board, and books for top academic scholarships.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Occupational Health Science
EnglishScore: Evidence of English proficiency is required of all applicants whose native language is not English. Proficiency can be demonstrated by one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 500 on the paper-based test (PBT) or 61 on the Internet-based test (iBT); International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum score of 5.5; Pearson Test of English (PTE) with a minimum score of 46; Duolingo with a minimum score of 95; Successful completion of the ELS Language Centers level 112.
Requirements: Admission to the University is granted to students who show promise of success in a university curriculum. Applicants must submit a completed application for admission and an official high school transcript. For unconditional admission, applicants must meet one of the following criteria: 2.50 or higher cumulative high school GPA (on a 4.0 scale) OR 20 or higher ACT composite score (or SAT equivalent).
Department: School of Science, Engineering, and Mathematics
Description: The Bachelor of Arts (BA) and Bachelor of Science (BS) in Occupational Health Science program is designed for students seeking entry-level professional positions and/or graduate education within the fields of safety, health, and environmental (SHE) management. The degree provides an interdisciplinary approach focusing on technical skills and competencies, management, problem-solving, and communication skills necessary for addressing and preventing occupational injuries and illnesses in various industrial, governmental, and healthcare settings. Students are prepared to recognize, evaluate, and control environmental factors and stressors arising from the workplace that may cause sickness, impaired health and well-being, or significant discomfort among workers or the general public.
CostPerCredit: $350 per credit hour (In-state), $700 per credit hour (Out-of-state)
ScholarshipAmount: Ranges from $2,000 per year up to full cost of attendance

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Occupational Health Science
EnglishScore: Proficiency in the English language is a requirement for admission. All applicants whose native language is not English must provide evidence of English proficiency by meeting one of the following criteria: Minimum score of 6.0 on the IELTS; Minimum score of 61 on the TOEFL iBT; Minimum score of 500 on the TOEFL PBT; Minimum score of 95 on the Duolingo English Test; Minimum score of 50 on the PTE; Completion of English Composition I and II with grades of C or better from a regionally accredited U.S. college or university; Completion of the ELS Language Centers Intensive Program, Level 112; Graduation from a U.S. high school, after attending for at least two years; or Citizenship of a country from the list of English-speaking countries.
Requirements:
Admission to the University of North Alabama is based on a review of the high school academic record. Standardized test scores (ACT/SAT) are not required for admission consideration for most students.

Unconditional Admission:
- High school diploma from a regionally accredited high school
- At least a 2.25 high school grade point average (GPA)
- At least 15 approved units of high school work

Conditional Admission:
- High school diploma from a regionally accredited high school
- At least a 2.00 high school grade point average (GPA)
- At least 15 approved units of high school work
Department: Anderson College of Nursing and Health Professions
Fees: In-state: $4,860/semester; Out-of-state: $8,856/semester (flat rate for 12-18 credit hours)
Description: The Bachelor of Science in Occupational Health Science prepares students for careers as occupational health and safety professionals. The program provides the knowledge and skills necessary to anticipate, recognize, evaluate, and control occupational health and safety hazards. Graduates are prepared for a variety of roles including safety officers, industrial hygienists, and environmental health specialists in various industries, government agencies, and consulting firms. The curriculum emphasizes both the scientific principles and practical applications of occupational health and safety, including risk assessment, regulatory compliance, ergonomics, toxicology, and emergency preparedness. Students will gain hands-on experience through laboratory work and internship opportunities, fostering a comprehensive understanding of real-world challenges in the field.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Physics (General Physics Option)
Requirements: UNA has a test-optional admission policy for first-time freshmen. Regular admission requirements include graduation from a regionally accredited high school with a regular or advanced diploma, and at least a 2.25 cumulative high school GPA (on a 4.0 scale).
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Physics program focuses on the principles of the universe, from the very large (cosmology) to the very small (quantum mechanics). Students in the Physics program develop critical thinking skills and problem-solving abilities that are highly sought after by employers and graduate programs. Graduates with a B.A. in Physics pursue a wide range of careers including engineering, computer science, research, education, and medicine, to name a few. The General Physics Option is designed for students seeking a broad education in physics and preparing for careers outside of pure physics research, or for those intending to pursue graduate studies in interdisciplinary fields. It provides a strong foundation in physics while allowing flexibility for students to tailor their studies with elective courses.
CostPerCredit: In-State: $343 per credit hour, Out-of-State: $686 per credit hour

ProgramName: Bachelor of Science in Physics (General Physics Option)
EnglishScore: An applicant whose native language is not English must submit evidence of proficiency in the English language. This may be done by submitting a minimum score of 500 on the paper-based test (PBT) or 61 on the Internet-based test (iBT) of the Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL); or a minimum score of 5.5 on the International English Language Testing System (IELTS); or a minimum score of 46 on the Pearson Test of English (PTE); or a minimum score of 95 on the Duolingo English Test (DET); or by successful completion of Level 109 of the English for Academic Purposes program of an ELS Language Center.
Requirements:
First-time freshmen who graduated high school less than three years prior to the start of their entry term are required to submit an official ACT or SAT score report. Additionally, first-time freshmen are required to submit an official high school transcript showing GPA and graduation date.

Unconditional Admission:
- High school GPA of 2.25 or higher; and
- Composite ACT score of 18 or higher (or SAT score of 940 or higher).

Conditional Admission:
- High school GPA of 2.00 or higher; and
- Composite ACT score of 16 or 17 (or SAT score of 860-930).
Department: College of Arts, Sciences, and Engineering
Description: The Bachelor of Science (BS) in Physics with a General Physics Option is designed to prepare students for a wide variety of career opportunities or for graduate school. The Physics curriculum provides a strong background in mathematics and physics, with additional work in areas of interest to the student, such as computer science, engineering, or research. Students are encouraged to participate in undergraduate research and to complete an internship.

ProgramName: Bachelor of Arts in Political Science
EnglishScore: Applicants whose native language is not English must submit evidence of English proficiency. This can be demonstrated by one of the following: Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) with a minimum score of 61 on the Internet-based test or 500 on the paper-based test. The UNA TOEFL code is 1735. International English Language Testing System (IELTS) with a minimum score of 5.5. Pearson Test of English (PTE) Academic with a minimum score of 46. Duolingo English Test with a minimum score of 95. Successful completion of ELS Language Center's level 112. A grade of C or better in English Composition from a regionally accredited U.S. college or university. Graduation from a U.S. high school that is regionally accredited. Citizenship from the following countries: Antigua and Barbuda, Australia, Bahamas, Barbados, Belize, Canada (except Quebec), Dominica, Grenada, Guyana, Ireland, Jamaica, New Zealand, St. Kitts and Nevis, St. Lucia, St. Vincent and the Grenadines, Trinidad and Tobago, United Kingdom.
